# Plasmode Simulation

[Franklin et al. 2014](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24587587/): resampling from the observed covariate and exposure data without modification in all simulated datasets to <mark>preserve the associations</mark> among these variables

**Original demographic variables**

```{verbatim}
age, sex, education, race, marital status, income, born, cycle 
```

**Original behaviour variables**

```{verbatim}
smoking, diet, high cholesterol, physical activity, sleep
```

**Original health history / access variables**

```{verbatim}
diabetes family history, medical access
```

**Transformed lab variables** (complex forms)

```{verbatim}
Tranfored.var.1 = log(globulin)
Tranfored.var.2 = protein*calcium
Tranfored.var.3 = diastolicBP/systolicBP)^2
Tranfored.var.4 = sqrt(uric acid+bilirubin)/2
Tranfored.var.5 = phosphorus^2/(sodium*potassium)
Tranfored.var.6 = log(systolicBP+10)
```

**Count based prescription codes** (proxies of health status)

```{verbatim}
Simple count = sum of selected ICD-10 CM codes
```

## Plasmode Simulation

True outcome model

```{verbatim}
Diabetes (outcome) =  Obese (exposure) + 
  
                      demographic/behaviour/health history variables + 
  
                      transformed lab variables +
  
                      simple count with selected ICD-10 codes
```

Detailed model:

```{verbatim}
Diabetes = Obese + 
            age + gender + education + race + income + born + 
            diabetes.family.history + high.cholesterol + medical.access + 
            smoking + diet.healthy + physical.activity + sleep + year  + 
            tranfored var.1 + var.2 + var.3 + var.4 + var.5 + var.6 +
            simple count (with log-OR 5 times the original)
```

-   **Size** of each cohort = 5,000
-   500 **simulations**/cohort generation
-   **Outcome** rate = 0.4
-   **Exposure** prevalence = 0.2
-   True exposure **Odds ratio** = 1 or **Risk difference** = 0
